parameters.description: The unique identifier for the runtime view. The input string should be the word 'latest', which will get the latest runtime view of the pool, otherwise the request will fail with NotFound exception.

ContainerGroupInstanceCountSummary.description: Displays the counts of container groups in each state, as known by the StandbyPool resource provider.

zone.description: The zone that the provided counts are in. It will not have a value if zones are not enabled.

instanceCountsByState.description: The count of pooled container groups in each state for the given zone.

id.description: Specifies container group profile id of standby container groups.

revision.description: Specifies revision of container group profile.

containerGroupProfile.description: Specifies container group profile of standby container groups.

subnetIds.description: Specifies subnet Ids for container group.

PoolContainerGroupState.description: The state of the pooled container groups.

values.name: Running
values.description: The container group is up and running.

PoolContainerGroupStateCount.description: Displays the counts of pooled container groups in each state, as known by the StandbyPool resource provider.

state.description: The state that the pooled container groups count is for.

count.description: The count of pooled container groups in the given state.

code.description: Displays the healthy state of the StandbyPool.

message.description: Displays the StandbyPool health state details.

PoolVirtualMachineState.description: The state of the pooled virtual machines.

values.name: Running
values.description: The virtual machine is up and running.

values.name: Deallocated
values.description: The virtual machine has released the lease on the underlying hardware and is powered off.

values.name: Deallocating
values.description: The virtual machine is releasing the lease on the underlying hardware and is powered off.

values.name: Hibernated
values.description: The virtual machine has released the lease on the underlying hardware and is powered off. Memory contents of the VM are stored in the OS disk. When started again, applications and processes that were previously running in your VM resume from the state prior to hibernation.

PoolVirtualMachineStateCount.description: Displays the counts of pooled virtual machines in each state, as known by the StandbyPool resource provider.

state.description: The state that the pooled virtual machines count is for.

count.description: The count of pooled virtual machines in the given state.

values.name: always
values.description: A refill policy that standby pool is automatically refilled to maintain maxReadyCapacity.

StandbyContainerGroupPoolElasticityProfi.description: Specifies the elasticity profile of the standby container group pools.

maxReadyCapacity.description: Specifies maximum number of standby container groups in the standby pool.

refillPolicy.description: Specifies refill policy of the pool.

StandbyContainerGroupPoolForecastValues.description: Displays the forecast information of the standby pool.

instancesRequestedCount.description: Displays the predicted count of instances to be requested from the standby pool.

StandbyContainerGroupPoolPrediction.description: Displays prediction information of the standby pool.

forecastValues.description: Displays the forecast information of the standby pool.

forecastStartTime.description: Displays the UTC timestamp of when the prediction was retrieved for the standby pool.

forecastInfo.description: Displays additional information for the prediction of the standby pool.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

provisioningState.description: Displays the provisioning state of the standby pool

prediction.description: Displays prediction information of the standby pool

maxReadyCapacity.description: Specifies the maximum number of virtual machines in the standby virtual machine pool.

minReadyCapacity.description: Specifies the desired minimum number of virtual machines in the standby virtual machine pool. MinReadyCapacity cannot exceed MaxReadyCapacity.

instancesRequestedCount.description: Displays the predicted count of instances to be requested from the standby pool.

forecastStartTime.description: Displays the UTC timestamp of when the prediction was retrieved for the standby pool.

StandbyVirtualMachinePoolRuntimeViewReso.description: Contains information about a standby pool as last known by the StandbyPool resource provider.

instanceCountSummary.description: A list containing the counts of virtual machines in each possible power state for each zone if enabled, as known by the StandbyPool resource provider. If zones are not enabled on the attached VMSS, the list will contain a single entry without zone values. Note: any resources in the Running state may still be installing extensions / not fully provisioned.

status.description: Display status of the standby pool

provisioningState.description: Displays the provisioning state of the standby pool

prediction.description: Displays prediction information of the standby pool

StandbyVirtualMachineResource.description: Concrete proxy resource types can be created by aliasing this type using a specific property type.

properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

value.description: The StandbyVirtualMachineResource items on this page

nextLink.description: The link to the next page of items

virtualMachineResourceId.description: Resource id of the virtual machine.

provisioningState.description: The status of the last operation.

id.description: Specifies ARM resource id of the subnet.

VirtualMachineInstanceCountSummary.description: Contains the counts of VMs in each power state in a given zone, fault domain, as known by the StandbyPool resource provider. Note: any resources in the Running state may still be installing extensions / not fully provisioned.

zone.description: The zone that the provided counts are in. It will not have a value if zones are not enabled on the attached VMSS.

instanceCountsByState.description: The count of pooled virtual machines in each state for the given zone.

values.name: Running
values.description: The virtual machine is up and running.

values.name: Deallocated
values.description: The virtual machine has released the lease on the underlying hardware and is powered off.

values.name: Hibernated
values.description: The virtual machine has released the lease on the underlying hardware and is powered off. Memory contents of the VM are stored in the OS disk.  When started again, applications and processes that were previously running in your VM resume from the state prior to hibernation.
